data.title: Allen Cain making another run at Capital One Academic All-America award
data.meta_description: span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family: arial; font-size: small; ">SEGUIN, Texas -- Texas Lutheran place-kicker <dfn><a href="/roster.aspx?rp_i ...
data.text:
SEGUIN, Texas -- Texas Lutheran place-kicker Allen Cain is making another run at Capital One Academic All-America honors.

Cain (San Antonio/Stevens) advanced this week to the national ballot for Academic All-American when he was named to the Capital One Academic First Team All-District 8 for NCAA Division III.

Cain was a Capital One First Team Academic All-American and a First Team Academic All-District selection in 2011. He also earned four playing All-America honors in 2011 and was a pre-season All-American for 2012. Cain is on the 2012 "Watch List" for the Fred Mitchell Award.

The all-time leader in field goals for the American Southwest Conference and for TLU, Cain is a senior computer science and mathematics major. He holds a cumulative grade point average of 3.51.

Voting for the Academic All-America national ballot commences on Wednesday and concludes Tuesday, Nov. 20. The Academic All-America Team for NCAA Division III is released on Dec. 4

Nominations and voting for Academic All-America awards are carried out by college and university sports information directors. In voting by sports information directors in NCAA Division III District 8, Cain secured the lone spot reserved for a kicker on the team.

District 8 nominating and voting includes eligible student-athletes from NCAA Division III colleges and universities in: Alaska, Arizona, California, Colorado, Hawaii, Iowa, Idaho, Kansas, Louisiana, Montana, North Dakota, Nebraska, New Mexico, Nevada, Oklahoma, Oregon, South Dakota, Texas, Utah, Washington, Wyoming, and Canada.

On the field this year, Cain leads the American Southwest Conference in field goals made (15) and sits third in NCAA DIII in field goals made per game. In his career, he has made 41 field goals. Cain is the scoring leader among all-time TLU kickers. With 226 career points, he is second all-time among all TLU players for career scoring.

Cain has made 15 of his 23 field goal attempts this season. He has made three kicks over 50 yards. Cain drilled a school-record 59-yard field goal in a road loss to No. 2-ranked Mary Hardin-Baylor.

Cain plays his final collegiate game for the Bulldogs this Saturday. The Bulldogs play Howard Payne in Brownwood, Texas. Kickoff is set for 2 p.m.

TLU will have live video on tlubulldogs.com and an audio-only webcast on seguintoday.com. Seguin radio station KWED 1580 AM will have the call. Pre-game coverage starts at 1:30 p.m.
